channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Disney+ shows off 'Star Wars: The Bad Batch' with an action-packed trailer
item.description: The 'Clone Wars' spin-off premieres on May 4th with a 70-minute episode.

item.title: SpaceX lost its fourth Starship prototype in a row
item.description: SpaceX lost its SN11 Starship prototype in mid-flight, possibly due to an engine failure.

item.title: Start learning C++, C#, SQL and more with these expert-led training courses
item.description: With The Complete C Suite Programming Bundle, you’ll receive 81 hours of training on C++, C#, SQL and more from experienced professionals.

item.title: Meet SpaceX's first all-civilian flight crew
item.description: SpaceX and Shift4 have revealed the full crew for Inspiration4, SpaceX's first all-civilian mission.

item.title: Xiaomi's first foldable phone has a shape-shifting 'liquid lens' camera
item.description: Xiaomi unveiled its first foldable phone, the Mi Mix Fold, which follows the same inward-folding form factor as Huawei's Mate X2 and Samsung's Galaxy Z Fold 2. What makes this device stand out, though, is the "liquid lens" on one of its rear cameras.

item.title: Apple is keeping WWDC free and online-only for 2021
item.description: For the second year in a row, Apple's Worldwide Developer Conference will be completely virtual. The company announced today that the online show will take place between June 7th and 11th — just like last year — and that it will once again be free to all registered developers. “We are working to make WWDC21 our biggest and best yet, and are excited to offer Apple developers new tools to support them as they create apps that change the way we live, work, and play," said Susan Prescott, Apple’s VP of Worldwide Developer Relations.

item.title: Spotify's plans for live audio include its own version of Clubhouse
item.description: The company is revamping Locker Room, a live audio app it bought, to focus on music, sports and cultural conversations.

item.title: Lexus' LF-Z Electrified concept offers a peek at upcoming EVs
item.description: Lexus has unveiled the LF-Z Electrified, a concept car that hints at the brand's EV future.

item.title: 'Super Mario 3D All-Stars' goes away forever on March 31st
item.description: As Super Mario's 35th anniversary comes to end, some titles will be leaving the Nintendo eShop and retailers forever.

item.title: Bang & Olufsen's wireless Xbox headset offers Dolby Atmos and ANC
item.description: Bang & Olufsen's $499 Beoplay Portal headphones are designed to work seamlessly with Xbox consoles.

item.title: Google Nest Hub (2nd gen) review: A great smart display and mediocre sleep tracker
item.description: For $100, the Nest Hub is already a compelling smart display that’s cheaper than the original, with the sleep tracking being an added bonus. But based on my testing, I’m not sure I can count on it to improve my sleeping patterns just yet.

item.title: PayPal now lets US customers check out with cryptocurrency
item.description: PayPal is giving you a way to pay for purchases directly with your cryptocurrency stash.

item.title: Virgin Galactic’s VSS Imagine is its shiny, next-gen spaceship
item.description: Virgin Galactic's SpaceShip III will start ground tests later this year. It’s an eye-catching vessel, finished with a mirror-like material that’s meant to reflect its surroundings. The coating also offers thermal protection.

item.title: Call of Duty games get a big update that actually reduces file sizes
item.description: Activision's new Call of Duty Season Two Reloaded update reduces file sizes for both Warzone and Modern Warfare across platforms.

item.title: LinkedIn now lets you add pronouns to your profile
item.description: LinkedIn will allow all its users to add pronouns to the top of their profiles.

item.title: This wearable MIDI controller can control Zoom calls too
item.description: Now you can control Zoom and Powerpoint with Genki's wearable MIDI controller.

item.title: Skullcandy's latest AirPods alternative only costs $25
item.description: Skullcandy's Dime earbuds offer most of the perks of true wireless at a fraction of the cost.

item.title: The Morning After: Volkswagen's 'Voltswagen' rebrand can't be real, can it?
item.description: Today’s headlines: Tesla customers say they've been double-charged for their cars, the Biden administration targets 30 gigawatts of offshore wind turbines by 2030 and is Volkswagen really going to rename its US business 'Voltswagen’?

item.title: FTC gives up on its antitrust battle with Qualcomm
item.description: The US Federal Trade Commission won't be pursuing its antitrust case against Qualcomm anymore four years after it filed a lawsuit against the company for alleged anti-competitive practices.

item.title: Xiaomi confirms it is getting into the EV business
item.description: Xiaomi has confirmed an earlier report that it will start an electric car business, with an initial investment of $1.5 billion and $10 billion over the next 10 years.

item.title: Mercedes-Benz's EQS interior is a blend of luxury and high-tech
item.description: While we wait for Mercedes-Benz to unveil its 2022 EQS luxury EV sedan on April 15th, the automaker has given us the first detailed look at the interior.

item.title: IBM’s first ‘retail’ quantum computer is headed to the Cleveland Clinic
item.description: The Cleveland Clinic has announced a 10-year partnership with IBM that will see it become the world's first private sector company with an on-premises IBM quantum computer.

item.title: Google Maps adds indoor AR directions and prioritizes eco-friendly routes
item.description: Today, the company is unveiling a set of updates that should make the app more helpful in more scenarios. For one thing, it's bringing its AR navigation tool Live View to some indoor locations like select malls, airports and transit stations.

item.title: Tesla customers say they've been double-charged for their cars
item.description: Tesla buyers have been reporting that they've been double-charged on cars for recent purchases and have had trouble contacting the company and getting their money back.

item.title: Kia officially debuts its EV6 AWD electric crossover
item.description: Kia officially debuted its new EV6 compact crossover on Tuesday. As suspected, the first dedicated BEV built on the company’s new E-GMP platform will offer a bevy of all-electric powertrain choices as well as the option for AWD.
